answers.author: Leslie Beauregard
answers.text:
For the last three out of five years, Charlottesville has provided one time bonuses rather than COLA increases.  They were significant - between $500 - $750.  Employees did appreciate the bonus, especially the years we were able to hold back increases in health care costs so their take home pay did not decrease. In FY 14, we are proposing a 2% COLA however.

text: Has your organization considered providing employees with a onetime pay adjustment in lieu of a merit or COLA increase? How did employees respond to the one time pay adjustment concept? Did it work?
title: COLA & Merit versus One time pay adjustment
